titleStmt.title: The predestinated thief A dialogue betwixt a rigid Calvinian preacher and a condemned malefactor. In which is not onely represented how the Calvinistical opinion occasions the perpetration of wickedness and impieties; but moreover how it doth impede and hinder, nay almost impossibilitate the reducing of a sinner to emendation and repentance.
titleStmt.author: Slatius, Henry, 1585-1623.

titleStmt.title: The predestinated thief A dialogue betwixt a rigid Calvinian preacher and a condemned malefactor. In which is not onely represented how the Calvinistical opinion occasions the perpetration of wickedness and impieties; but moreover how it doth impede and hinder, nay almost impossibilitate the reducing of a sinner to emendation and repentance.
titleStmt.author: Slatius, Henry, 1585-1623.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by R. Trott for Daniel Jones, and are to be sold at the three Hearts in S. Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Caption title on p. 1 reads: A dialogue had betwixt a Calvinist preacher and a condemned malefactor.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
